Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for the 4th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT 2017)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration: Big Data have become one of the key challenges in many research areas. Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies, BDCAT 2017, serves as a platform for researchers to share with the community their discoveries in various aspects of big data computing, including big data science, infrastructures and platforms, big data applications, big data trends and challenges, as well as visualization of big data. The conference will also provide an education opportunity for students participants, where they will be exposed to novel techniques and learn state-of- the-art methodologies. In addition, the travel award recipients will have opportunities to closely interact with a group of faculty mentors, who will provide constructive feedback on their research projects, as well as career guidance.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Today “big data” has become the key challenge in many research areas. BDCAT 2017 serves as a platform for researchers to share with the community their discoveries in various aspects of big data computing, including big data science, infrastructures and platforms, big data applications, big data trends and challenges, as well as visualization of big data. Attending such a premium international conference is an excellent opportunity for students to interact with peers and researchers in the field. The conference had 140 total participants, with 85 U.S. participants and 55 representing people from sixteen other countries. Among the 140 participants, 32 were students. 

 

This project funded 14 students in total to attend to attend the 4th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT 2017), which was held in Austin, Texas from December 5ththrough December 8thof 2017. Among the 14 awardees, 10 are from U.S. institutions, and 4 are from international institutions. Two awardees are female students. Awardees were selected via a rigorous application and review process by an award committee consisting of 4 faculty members. During the conference, the awardees were offered opportunities to interact with conference chairs, researchers, and peer students through various of activities, including a Graduate Student Symposium, round table discussion, and other networking events. The awardees were also mentored on various topics including thesis writing clinics, conference participation and networking tips, etc. This project has impact in stimulating students’ enthusiasm in conducting research in big data computing, providing opportunities for the students to interact with top researchers in the field, and training future workforce for the nation.
